Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2017 01:30AM - edited Dec 3, 2017 01:31AM by ahw1971 My local Oncologist didn't want to,do a Mammaprint or Oncotype test saying that these tests should only be done if you don't want chemo. I went and had a 2nd opinion and she has ordered a Mammaprint and said if it came back as a Low risk, that I would not need to do chemo. I don't know how I feel about not doing chemo if the Mammaprint comes back low risk. Has anyone had their doubts about not doing chemo and has anyone had chemo with a Low risk result? My Breast cancer is Invasive ductal Stage II Er+, Pr+, her2-. Grade 1, 1/5 sentinel nodes positive. Genetic testing was also negative
Posts.Title: Mammaprint-who has had one? LizabethM gb2115

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2017 01:52AM ahw1971 wrote: it is a test done on the tumor to determine whether you are Low risk or High risk of your cancer returning. It also determines of you will need chemoor not.
Posts.Title: Mammaprint-who has had one? LizabethM gb2115

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2017 02:09AM - edited Dec 3, 2017 02:10AM by ahw1971 thanks! My local MO want to do Taxotere and Cytoxan and I think I would feel better with chemo even if MP is Low risk
